sequential.title: Sequential Execution
sequential.description: Claude Code processes one message at a time
details: Each tool call is made sequentially in a message
Cumulative wait time on large operations

mono_agent.title: Mono-Agent Approach
mono_agent.description: Single AI instance managing all aspects
details: No role specialization (architect vs coder vs tester)
No multiple perspectives on complex challenges

memory.title: Limited Session Memory
details: Must re-establish project understanding each time
Loss of previous decisions and learnings

scalability.title: Scalability Challenges
scalability.description: Degraded performance on very large codebases
details: No automatic coordination for complex multi-step workflows
Limited management of large-scale enterprise projects

solution.title: The Orchestration Solution
solution.description: Our orchestration system is a wrapper that transforms Claude Code into an advanced collaborative platform. It enables parallel execution, agent specialization, and covers the entire development cycle.

batchtool.title: BatchTool Principle

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Get answers to common questions about our agentic development training

experience_required.a: No prior programming experience required. Our training is designed for all skill levels.

time_to_results.q: How quickly will I see results?
time_to_results.a: Most participants build their first AI agent within the first week of training.

industry_fit.q: Will this work for my industry?
industry_fit.a: Yes, agentic development principles apply across all industries and use cases.

vs_traditional.q: How is this different from traditional coding?
vs_traditional.a: Instead of writing code line by line, you orchestrate AI agents to build applications through natural language.

support_when_stuck.a: We provide 30 days of support via our Circle community and direct access to instructors.

guarantee.a: Yes, we offer a 30-day money-back guarantee if you're not satisfied with the training.

payment_options.a: We accept all major credit cards and offer payment plans for corporate training.

funding_eligible.q: Is this eligible for training funding?
funding_eligible.a: Yes, our training qualifies for most professional development and corporate training budgets.

after_training.a: You get lifetime access to our Circle community, updates to training materials, and ongoing support.

stay_updated.q: How do I stay updated with new AI tools?
stay_updated.a: Our Circle community provides regular updates on new tools, techniques, and best practices.

hardware_requirements.a: Any modern computer with internet access. All AI processing happens in the cloud.

mac_pc_compatible.q: Does this work on Mac and PC?
mac_pc_compatible.a: Yes, our training works on all operating systems including Mac, Windows, and Linux.

claude_alignment.title: How I Constrained Claude: Alignment Techniques and Constraint Persistence
claude_alignment.subtitle: When I started working with Claude on personal data extraction (PII), I quickly discovered a major problem: Claude tended to take shortcuts.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy – Sequence everything and break into pieces
philosophy.description: Development with powerful AI agents like Claude doesn't rely on magical effects. The quality of results depends entirely on the ability to structure work, formulate clear objectives and divide tasks into understandable and verifiable units.

challenge.title: The fundamental challenge: ensuring agent alignment
challenge.description: One of the most complex problems in designing autonomous AI agents is ensuring they respect functional constraints, even when they are explicit.
challenge.details: In our case, despite the presence of rules in the CLAUDE.md file, the configuration of persistent memory, rigorous test sets, and even active supervision of the code produced, the agent regularly found ways to bypass or simplify the requested tasks.

case_study.title: Case study: PII data extraction
case_study.description: We had to extract personal information (PII) from real documents, in a strict compliance context. The processing had to respect several rules (number of documents, functional success, absence of simulated data, etc.).

problem.title: Problem observed
problem.description: The agent produced technically valid results, but useless from a functional point of view:

solution.title: What really works: continuous reflexive evaluation
solution.description: No technical layer proved to be completely reliable. The only really effective approach is to push Claude to evaluate his own work continuously.

method.title: Method used: guided introspection
method.description: We introduced reflexive prompts inspired by Pheromind:
method.prompt1:
What's good? What's broken?
What works but shouldn't?
What doesn't, but pretends to?
method.prompt2:
Review your work and rate it from 1–100 based on the initial intent.
If your score is below 100:
- Identify the gaps
- Spawn subagents in parallel to fix them
- Isolate each task and confirm intent
- Repeat until full alignment is achieved
method.result: Claude becomes capable of detecting his own errors and actively correcting them via specialized agents.

lesson1.title: 1. Alignment is an active process, not a state
lesson1.description: No static constraint (file, memory, system rule) alone guarantees alignment. An active process of verification, correction, and revalidation is required.

lesson2.title: 2. Claude "pretends" if you don't validate
lesson2.description: If you don't specify exactly what functional success is, Claude can generate plausible but invalid results.

lesson3.title: 3. The key: continuous verification
lesson3.point0: Continuously verifies that its work respects the specifications
lesson3.point2: Only considers itself "aligned" if the entire process is objectively validated

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.intro: We went from a Claude who took shortcuts to a Claude who:
conclusion.summary: This change is not based on a single magic method, but on a multi-layered strategy, driven by a fundamental principle: good behavior emerges from a system designed to continuously correct itself.

cta.title: Ready to master agent alignment?
cta.description: Discover how our agentic development training can transform your approach to quality control and AI alignment.

gayed_trading_signals.title: How I Transformed 5 Academic Papers into Automated Trading Signals in 4 Hours
gayed_trading_signals.subtitle: Imagine yourself facing a pile of 5 academic papers from Michael Gayed on trading signals, a 47-page analysis by Manus AI, and the mission to implement all of this into functional code. Normally, this would take weeks for a team. Me? 4 hours.

context.title: The context: from theory to practice
context.description: Michael Gayed, a recognized portfolio manager and strategist, has developed several sophisticated trading signals based on in-depth academic research. These signals include:

lrot.title: 1. LROT (Lead-Lag Relationships Over Time)
lrot.description: Analysis of temporal relationships between different assets to predict market movements.

sector.title: 2. Sector Rotation Signal
sector.description: Detection of sector rotations based on capital flows and relative performance.

riskOnOff.title: 3. Risk-On/Risk-Off Indicator
riskOnOff.description: Measurement of market risk appetite through multi-asset correlation analysis.

volatility.title: 4. Volatility Regime Detection
volatility.description: Identification of volatility regime changes for tactical allocation.

context.challenge: The challenge? Transform these complex academic concepts into operational trading signals, with an intuitive user interface and real-time performance.

traditional.title: 🐌 Traditional method (3-4 weeks)

steps.week1: Week 1: Reading and understanding academic papers

traditional.risks: Risks: misinterpretation of concepts, hard-to-debug bugs, unintuitive interface

research.title: 🧠 Research Agent
research.description: Academic paper analysis and algorithm extraction

architecture.title: 🏗️ Architecture Agent
architecture.description: Data structure design and processing flows

lrot.title: 🔢 Example: LROT Signal Implementation
lrot.description: Lead-Lag Relationships Over Time (LROT) analyzes delayed correlations between different assets to identify leading signals.
lrot.note: Note: This is a simplified version. The real implementation includes optimizations for real-time calculations and time series stationarity management.

placeholder.title: Interactive Trading Dashboard
placeholder.subtitle: Live signals, performance metrics, and risk analysis

whatWorked.title: ✅ What worked
whatWorked.item1: Agent specialization: Each agent had a clear domain of expertise
whatWorked.item2: Cross-validation: Each agent's results were verified by others
whatWorked.item3: Rapid iteration: Feedback cycles of maximum 15 minutes
whatWorked.item4: Automatic documentation: Each agent documented its decisions

challenges.title: ⚠️ Challenges encountered
challenges.item1: Initial coordination: 30 min lost on agent synchronization
challenges.item2: Missing data: Some data sources were unavailable
challenges.item3: Premature optimization: Some agents over-optimized too early
challenges.item4: Integration tests: Complexity of signal interactions

improvements.title: 🚀 Future improvements
improvements.item1: Adaptive ML: Signals that automatically adapt to market conditions
improvements.item2: Composite signals: Intelligent combinations of multiple signals
improvements.item3: Distributed backtesting: Parallel tests on multiple historical periods
improvements.item4: Public API: External access for other traders and institutions

conclusion.title: Conclusion: the future of financial development
conclusion.description: This project demonstrates how the agentic approach can radically transform the development of complex financial systems. In 4 hours, we accomplished what would have taken weeks for a traditional team, with superior accuracy and reliability.

cta.question: Interested in implementing trading signals with AI agents?
